trans-unit.source: Represents a configuration element that specifies settings for an instance of <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime"></xref> for hosting workflow-based Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) services.
To enable or disable one of the `ServiceDebugElement` features using a configuration file, you must:
Add a behavior configuration attribute to the service element of your [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] service.
Endpoint behaviors are configured on `endpoint` elements; service behaviors are configured on `service` elements.
Create a `serviceBehaviors` section, and add a behavior element with the name that corresponds to the `behaviorConfiguration` attribute value from step 1.
Add a `serviceDebug` element to the behavior element from step 2, and enable or disable the various properties as needed.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.WorkflowRuntimeElement"></xref> class.
Gets the type of this behavior element.
The type of the behavior.
Gets or sets a value that specifies the time that a cached instance will expire.
The time that a cached instance will expire.
Gets the collection of common parameters used by services.
This collection will typically include the database connection string that might be shared by durable services.
A `NameValueConfigurationCollection` that contains common parameters used by services.
The default is `null`.
Creates a custom behavior based on the settings of this configuration element.
A custom behavior based on the settings of this configuration element.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether performance counters are enabled.
Performance counters provide information on various workflow-related statistics, but they cause a performance penalty when the workflow runtime engine starts, and when workflow instances are running.
The default value is `true`.
`true` if performance counters are enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the name of the workflow runtime engine.
This property is used to set <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime.Name%2A>.
The default is an empty string.
A string that contains the name of the workflow runtime engine.

Gets a <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyCollection"></xref> instance that contains a collection of <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty"></xref> objects that can be attributes or <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement"></xref> objects of this configuration element.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.NetTcpContextBindingElement.ContextProtectionLevel%2A> property is also contained in this property collection.

A <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyCollection"></xref> instance that contains a collection of <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty"></xref> objects that can be attributes or <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement"></xref> objects of this configuration element.
Gets the collection of services that will be added to the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime"></xref> engine.

The services specified in the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Configuration.WorkflowRuntimeServiceElementCollection> will be initialized by the workflow runtime engine and added to its services when the appropriate <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime> constructor is called.
Therefore, the services specified in the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Configuration.WorkflowRuntimeServiceElementCollection> must follow certain rules about the signatures of their constructors.
For more information, see <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Configuration.WorkflowRuntimeServiceElement>.
The collection of services that will be added to the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime"></xref> engine.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether validation will occur on creation of the workflow instance.
When this property is set to `true`, the workflow validation is executed every time <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime.CreateWorkflow%2A> is called.
If validation errors are found, a <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.WorkflowValidationFailedException> error is thrown.
When this property is set to `false`, <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime.CreateWorkflow%2A> creates a workflow instance and skips validation.
In this case, the host application must ensure that the workflow is properly configured, or the runtime error occurs.
The default value for this property is `true`.
`true` if validation will occur on creation; otherwise, `false`.
